4242     <p>You can apply for an Access to Work grant if you have a disability or health condition that makes it difficult for you to work.</p>
43      <p>The money is to pay for <a href="intro3">practical support</a> to help you: </p>
43      <p>The grant can be used to pay for <a href="intro3">special equipment or personal support</a> to help you: </p>

45        <li>start working</li>
46        <li>keep working if you already have a job</li>
45        <li>start a new job</li>
46        <li>stay in work</li>
4747       <li>get to and from work</li>
48        <li>move into self-employment or start a business</li> 
4948     </ul>
50      <p>The grant is not for business start-up costs.</p>
51      <p>The money doesn’t have to be paid back and doesn't affect other benefits.</p>
49      <p>You can't get a grant for business start-up costs.</p>
50      <p>The grant doesn’t have to be paid back and won't affect any other benefits you get.</p>

55 <div class="intro-content">
56    <h2 class="heading-medium">2. Eligibility</h2>
57    <p>Access to Work grants are only available if the employer is based in England, Scotland or Wales. There's a different system in <a href="http://www.nidirect.gov.uk/access-to-work-practical-help-at-work">Northern Ireland.</a></p>
58    
59    <p>You must be 16 or over and either:</p>
60 
61 <ul class="list-bullet">
62      <li>about to start a job or work trial</li>
63      <li>in a paid job or self-employed (you can’t get a grant for voluntary work)</li>
64 </ul>
65 
66 <p>You might also qualify if you’re getting <a href="https://www.gov.uk/new-enterprise-allowance" target="_blank">New Enterprise Allowance</a> or starting work experience under a <a href="https://www.gov.uk/moving-from-benefits-to-work/job-search-programmes" target="_blank">Youth Contract</a>.</p>
67 
68 
69 <h2 class="heading-medium">Your condition</h2>
70 <p>Your disability or health condition must affect your ability to do a job or mean you have to pay work-related costs. For example, if you need to buy computer equipment or have to take taxis because you can’t use public transport.</p>
71    
72    
73 <h2 class="heading-medium">Exceptions</h2>
74 <p>You might not qualify if you get any of these benefits:</p>
75 
76 <ul class="list-bullet">
77      <li>Incapacity Benefit</li>
78      <li>Employment and Support Allowance</li>
79      <li>Severe Disability Allowance</li>
80      <li>Income Support</li>
81      <li>National Insurance Credits</li>
82 </ul>
83 
84 <h2 class="heading-medium">Changing jobs</h2>
85 <p>You may be able to take any special equipment that's been paid for with an Access to Work Grant with you if you change jobs. If you get regular grants (eg for travel to work) you'll have to apply for a new grant.</p>
86 
87 
88 </div>
38  <div class="intro-content">
39     <h2 class="heading-medium">2. Eligibility</h2>
40     <p>Access to Work grants are only available if you live and work in England, Scotland or Wales. There's a different system in <a href="http://www.nidirect.gov.uk/access-to-work-practical-help-at-work">Northern Ireland.</a></p>
41     <p>You must be 16 or over and either:</p>
42    <ul class="list-bullet">
43      <li>about to start a job or work trial</li>
44      <li>in a paid job or self-employed (you can’t get a grant for voluntary work)</li>
45    </ul>
46    <p>You might also qualify if you’re getting <a href="https://www.gov.uk/new-enterprise-allowance" target="_blank">New Enterprise Allowance</a> or starting work experience under a <a href="https://www.gov.uk/moving-from-benefits-to-work/job-search-programmes" target="_blank">Youth Contract</a>.</p>
47    <h2 class="heading-medium">Your condition</h2>
48    <p>Your disability or health condition must affect your ability to do a job or mean you have to pay work-related costs. For example, if you need to buy computer equipment or have to take taxis because you can’t use public transport.</p>
49    <h2 class="heading-medium">Exceptions</h2>
50    <p>You might not qualify if you get any of these benefits:</p>
51    <ul class="list-bullet">
52      <li>Incapacity Benefit</li>
53      <li>Job Seekers Allowance</li>
54      <li>Employment and Support Allowance</li>
55      <li>Severe Disability Allowance</li>
56      <li>Income Support</li>
57      <li>National Insurance Credits</li>
58    </ul>
59    <h2 class="heading-medium">Changing jobs</h2>
60    <p>You may be able to take any special equipment that's been paid for with an Access to Work Grant with you if you change jobs. If you get regular grants (eg for travel to work) you'll have to apply for a new grant.</p>
61  </div><!-- .intro-content -->

56    <h2 class="heading-medium">3. What you'll get</h2>
57    <p>How much you'll get depends on your condition and how much help you need.</p>
58 
59    <p>The grant can pay for things like:</p>
60 
61    <ul class="list-bullet">
62          <li>adaptations to the equipment you use</li>
63        <li>special equipment</li>
64        <li>fares to work if you can't use public transport</li>
65        <li>a support worker or job coach to help you in your workplace</li>
66        <li>a support service, if you have a mental health condition</li>
67        <li>disability awareness training for your colleagues</li>
68        <li>someone to help you communicate at a job interview</li>
69        <li>the cost of moving your equipment if you change location or job</li>
70    </ul>
71 
72    <h2 class="heading-medium">Changes to Access to Work from 1 October 2015</h2>
73    <p>From 1 October 2015 the maximum Access to Work grant that can be awarded is £40,800.</p>
74 <p>If your grant was awarded before 1 October 2015 and is worth more than £40,800 it will be reduced to the maximum limit in April 2018.</p>
75    </ul>

35         <p class="font-small" id="grant">To get an Access to Work grant you must:</p>

3626
37       <ul class="list-bullet" aria-labelledby="grant">
38            <li>be 16 or over</li>
39            <li>live and work in England, Scotland or Wales</li>
40            <li>have a job or a job interview</li>
41            <li>have a long term disability or health condition</li>
42      </ul>

50      <p class="font-small">Department for Work and Pensions will contact your employer when you apply and an assessor might have to visit you at work.</p>
51           <details>
52            <summary><span class="summary">About long term health conditions</span></summary>
53            <div class="panel-indent">
54                <p id="health">Your health condition or disability doesn't have to be permanent but you must either:</p>
55                <ul aria-labelledby="health" class='list-bullet'>
56                <li>have had it for at least a year</li>
57                <li>expect it to last at least another 12 months from when you apply</li>
58                </ul>
